TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable beforefieldinit CultureInfo extends System.Object implements class System.ICloneable, class System.IFormatProvider
Public Class CultureInfo Implements ICloneable, IFormatProvider
public ref class CultureInfo : ICloneable, IFormatProvider

summary.span: 提供特定文化特性 (Culture) 的相關資訊 (文化特性在非受控程式碼開發中稱為「地區設定」**)。

span.span: Provides information about a specific culture (called a *locale* for unmanaged code development).

summary.span: 這項資訊包含文化特性的名稱、書寫系統、使用的曆法、字串的排序次序，以及日期和數字的格式。

span.span: The information includes the names for the culture, the writing system, the calendar used, the sort order of strings, and formatting for dates and numbers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別提供特定文化特性資訊，例如語言、 次語言、 國家/地區、 行事曆和特定文化特性相關聯的慣例。The class provides culture-specific information, such as the language, sublanguage, country/region, calendar, and conventions associated with a particular culture. 這個類別也會提供存取的特定文化特性的執行個體， ， ，和物件。This class also provides access to culture-specific instances of the , , , and objects. 這些物件包含特定文化特性的作業，例如大小寫、 格式化日期和數字和比較字串所需的資訊。These objects contain the information required for culture-specific operations, such as casing, formatting dates and numbers, and comparing strings. 類別直接或間接類別使用的格式化、 剖析、 或處理特定文化特性的資料，例如， ， ，和數字類型。The class is used either directly or indirectly by classes that format, parse, or manipulate culture-specific data, such as , , , and the numeric types. 本節內容：In this section: [文化特性名稱和識別碼](#CultureNames) [Culture names and identifiers](#CultureNames) [非變異、 中性和特定文化特性](#Invariant) [Invariant, neutral, and specific cultures](#Invariant) [自訂文化特性](#Custom) [Custom cultures](#Custom) [動態的文化特性的資料](#Dynamic) [Dynamic culture data](#Dynamic) [目前 UI 文化特性與目前的文化特性](#Current) [The current culture and current UI culture](#Current) [取得所有文化特性](#GetAll) [Getting all cultures](#GetAll) [文化特性和執行緒](#Threads) [Culture and threads](#Threads) [文化特性和應用程式網域](#AppDomain) [Culture and application domains](#AppDomain) [文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業](#Async) [Culture and task-based asynchronous operations](#Async) [CultureInfo 物件的序列化](#Serialization) [CultureInfo object serialization](#Serialization) [控制台中會覆寫](#CPanel) [Control Panel overrides](#CPanel) [替代排序次序](#AlternateSort) [Alternate sort orders](#AlternateSort) [文化特性和 Windows 應用程式Culture and Windows apps](#Windows) ## 文化特性名稱和識別碼Culture names and identifiers 類別會指定每個文化特性，根據 RFC 4646 唯一的名稱。The class specifies a unique name for each culture, based on RFC 4646. 名稱是與語言相關聯的 ISO 639 兩個字母小寫文化特性代碼和國家或地區相關聯的 ISO 3166 雙字母大寫子代碼的組合。The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region. 此外，對於目標的應用程式[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]或更新版本，而且執行 Windows 10 或更新版本，對應至有效 bcp-47 語言標記受支援的文化特性名稱。In addition, for apps that target [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] or later and are running under Windows 10 or later, culture names that correspond to valid BCP-47 language tags are supported. > [!NOTE] > 當文化特性名稱傳遞至類別建構函式或方法例如或，其大小寫並不重要。When a culture name is passed to a class constructor or a method such as or , its case is not significant. 根據 RFC 4646 的文化特性名稱的格式是*languagecode2*>-*country/regioncode2*，其中*languagecode2*是兩個字母的語言代碼和*country/regioncode2*是兩個字母子程式碼。The format for the culture name based on RFC 4646 is *languagecode2*>-*country/regioncode2*, where *languagecode2* is the two-letter language code and *country/regioncode2* is the two-letter subculture code. 例如 JA-JP 日文 （日本） 和 EN-US 代表英文 （美國）。Examples include ja-JP for Japanese (Japan) and en-US for English (United States). 在兩個字母的語言碼不可以使用的情況下，會使用衍生自 ISO 639-2 三個字母代碼。In cases where a two-letter language code is not available, a three-letter code derived from ISO 639-2 is used. 請注意，某些文化特性名稱也會指定 ISO 15924 指令碼。Note that some culture names also specify an ISO 15924 script. 例如，Cyrl 指定斯拉夫文的指令碼並 Latn 指定英文的指令碼。For example, Cyrl specifies the Cyrillic script and Latn specifies the Latin script. 包含的指令碼的文化特性名稱會使用模式*languagecode2*-*scripttag*-*country/regioncode2*。A culture name that includes a script uses the pattern *languagecode2*-*scripttag*-*country/regioncode2*. 這種文化特性名稱的範例是代表代表烏茲別克文 （斯拉夫，烏茲別克）。An example of this type of culture name is uz-Cyrl-UZ for Uzbek (Cyrillic, Uzbekistan). 在 Windows Vista 之前 Windows 作業系統，包括指令碼的文化特性名稱會使用模式*languagecode2*-*country/regioncode2* - *scripttag*，例如代表-代表-Cyrl 烏茲別克文 （斯拉夫，烏茲別克）。On Windows operating systems before Windows Vista, a culture name that includes a script uses the pattern *languagecode2*-*country/regioncode2*-*scripttag*, for example, uz-UZ-Cyrl for Uzbek (Cyrillic, Uzbekistan). 中性文化特性是由兩個字母小寫語言程式碼指定。A neutral culture is specified by only the two-letter lowercase language code. 例如，fr 指定中性文化特性的法文和 de 指定德文中性文化特性。For example, fr specifies the neutral culture for French, and de specifies the neutral culture for German. > [!NOTE] > 有兩個有所出入此規則的文化特性名稱。There are two culture names that contradict this rule. 中文 （簡體），名為 zh-chs 和 Hans 和名為 zh-chs 和 Hant，中文 （繁體） 的文化特性是中性文化特性。The cultures Chinese (Simplified), named zh-Hans, and Chinese (Traditional), named zh-Hant, are neutral cultures. 文化特性名稱代表目前的標準，應該使用，除非您有使用較舊名稱的 ZH-CHS 和 ZH-CHT 的原因。The culture names represent the current standard and should be used unless you have a reason for using the older names zh-CHS and zh-CHT. 文化特性識別項為標準國際數字縮寫，來唯一識別已安裝的文化特性的其中一個所需的元件。A culture identifier is a standard international numeric abbreviation and has the components necessary to uniquely identify one of the installed cultures. 您的應用程式可以使用預先定義的文化特性識別項，或定義自訂的識別項。Your application can use predefined culture identifiers or define custom identifiers. 某些預先定義的文化特性名稱，這和中的其他類別所使用的識別項命名空間。Certain predefined culture names and identifiers are used by this and other classes in the namespace. 詳細的文化特性資訊會出現在[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global 開發人員中心。Detailed culture information appears in the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 請記住的文化特性名稱和識別碼，代表可以在特定的電腦發現的文化特性的子集。Remember that the culture names and identifiers represent only a subset of cultures that can be found on a particular computer. Windows 版本或 service pack 可以變更可用的文化特性。Windows versions or service packs can change the available cultures. 應用程式，將使用的自訂文化特性類別。Applications add custom cultures using the class. 使用者將使用 Microsoft 的地區設定產生器工具它們自己的自訂文化特性。Users add their own custom cultures using the Microsoft Locale Builder tool. Microsoft 的地區設定產生器以 managed 程式碼使用`CultureAndRegionInfoBuilder`類別。Microsoft Locale Builder is written in managed code using the `CultureAndRegionInfoBuilder` class. 數個不同的名稱是密切相關聯的文化特性，值得注意的是將下列類別成員相關聯的名稱：Several distinct names are closely associated with a culture, notably the names associated with the following class members: - - - ## 非變異、 中性和特定文化特性Invariant, neutral, and specific cultures 文化特性通常分為三個集合： 而異的文化特性、 中性文化特性和特定文化特性。The cultures are generally grouped into three sets: invariant cultures, neutral cultures, and specific cultures. 不區分文化特性的文化特性而異。An invariant culture is culture-insensitive. 您的應用程式指定文化特性而異，依名稱使用空字串 ("") 或依其識別項。Your application specifies the invariant culture by name using an empty string ("") or by its identifier. 定義文化特性而異的執行個體。 defines an instance of the invariant culture. 相關聯，所以與英文，但不是能搭配任何國家/地區。It is associated with the English language but not with any country/region. 在幾乎任何方法可以用於`Globalization`需要文化特性的命名空間。It is used in almost any method in the `Globalization` namespace that requires a culture. 中性文化特性是相關聯的文化特性使用的語言而非國家/地區。A neutral culture is a culture that is associated with a language but not with a country/region. 特定文化特性是一種語言和國家/地區相關聯的文化特性。A specific culture is a culture that is associated with a language and a country/region. 例如，fr 是為法文的文化特性中性的名稱和 FR-FR 是特定的法文 （法國） 文化特性的名稱。For example, fr is the neutral name for the French culture, and fr-FR is the name of the specific French (France) culture. 請注意，中文 （簡體） 和中文 （繁體） 也會被視為中性文化特性。Note that Chinese (Simplified) and Chinese (Traditional) are also considered neutral cultures. 建立的執行個體類別不建議中性文化特性，因為它所包含的資料是任意的。Creating an instance of a class for a neutral culture is not recommended because the data it contains is arbitrary. 若要顯示和排序資料，請指定語言和地區。To display and sort data, specify both the language and region. 此外，屬性為中性文化特性會傳回的國家/地區，並不包括地區建立的物件。Additionally, the property of a object created for a neutral culture returns only the country and does not include the region. 定義的文化特性有的階層中的特定文化特性的父項是中性文化特性和中性文化特性的父項是文化特性而異。The defined cultures have a hierarchy in which the parent of a specific culture is a neutral culture and the parent of a neutral culture is the invariant culture. 屬性包含中性文化特性特定的文化特性相關聯。The property contains the neutral culture associated with a specific culture. 自訂文化特性應該定義為了符合此模式的屬性。Custom cultures should define the property in conformance with this pattern. 如果特定文化特性的資源不會在作業系統中可用的則會使用相關聯的中性文化特性的資源。If the resources for a specific culture are not available in the operating system, the resources for the associated neutral culture are used. 如果無法使用中性文化特性的資源時，會使用主要組件中內嵌的資源。If the resources for the neutral culture are not available, the resources embedded in the main assembly are used. 如需有關資源後援程序的詳細資訊，請參閱[封裝和部署資源](~/docs/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps.md)。For more information on the resource fallback process, see [Packaging and Deploying Resources](~/docs/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps.md). Windows API 中的地區設定的清單會稍有不同.NET Framework 所支援的文化特性的清單。The list of locales in the Windows API is slightly different from the list of cultures supported by the .NET Framework. 如果需要與 Windows 交互操作性，比方說，透過 p/invoke 機制，應用程式應該使用特定文化特性所定義的作業系統。If interoperability with Windows is required, for example, through the p/invoke mechanism, the application should use a specific culture that is defined for the operating system. 使用特定文化特性可確保一致性，與對等的 Windows 地區設定，這識別與相同的地區設定識別碼。Use of the specific culture ensures consistency with the equivalent Windows locale, which is identified with a locale identifier that is the same as . A或可以建立只針對而異的文化特性或特定文化特性，而不中性文化特性。A or a can be created only for the invariant culture or for specific cultures, not for neutral cultures. 如果是但未設定為 ZH-TW，然後， ，和傳回空字串 ("")。If is the but the is not set to zh-TW, then , , and return an empty string (""). ## 自訂文化特性Custom cultures 除了 Windows 作業系統和.NET Framework 所支援的預先定義文化特性，.NET Framework 支援三種類型的自訂文化特性：In addition to the predefined cultures supported by the Windows operating system and the .NET Framework, the .NET Framework supports three types of custom cultures: - 補充的文化特性使用 Windows 或.NET Framework 中的新文化特性。New cultures that supplement the cultures available in Windows or the .NET Framework. 例如，應用程式無法安裝代表 FJ-FJ （或 Fijan （斐濟）） 文化特性的系統上的物件。For example, an application could install a object that represents the fj-FJ (or Fijan (Fiji)) culture on a system. - 其屬性會與不同的標準 Windows 和.NET Framework 所支援的文化特性屬性取代的文化特性。Replacement cultures whose properties are different from the properties of the standard cultures supported by Windows and the .NET Framework. - 標準使用者的文化特性會覆寫。Standard cultures with user overrides. 使用者可以使用**地區和語言**應用程式中**控制台**來自訂現有文化特性的屬性值。The user can use the **Region and Language** application in **Control Panel** to customize an existing culture's property values. > [!NOTE] > 您可以使用類別來定義、 儲存及註冊自訂的文化特性來補充或取代現有的文化特性。You can use the class to define, save, and register custom cultures that either supplement or replace existing cultures. 方法會建立可用來在目標系統上安裝自訂的文化特性的地區設定資料標記語言 (LDML) 檔案。The method creates a Locale Data Markup Language (LDML) file that can be used to install a custom culture on target systems. 如逐步步驟需使用類別來建立新的或取代文化特性，請參閱類別主題。For step-by step information on using the class to create a new or replacement culture, see the class topic. 由於.NET Framework 支援自訂文化特性，您應該考慮下列使用特定文化特性的資料時：Because the .NET Framework supports custom cultures, you should consider the following when working with culture-specific data: - 自訂文化特性都具有超過預先定義的文化特性而有所不同範圍的值。Custom cultures can have values that exceed the ranges of the predefined cultures. 例如，某些文化特性有超乎尋常地多個月份的名稱、 未預期的日期或時間格式或其他異常資料。For example, some cultures have unusually long month names, unexpected date or time formats, or other unusual data. - 當您在使用者介面中顯示特定文化特性的資料時，您應該採用使用者的自訂。例如，使用者可能會想 24 小時制或 yyyyMMdd 日期格式。When you display culture-specific data in the user interface, you should respect the user's customizations; for example, the user might want a 24-hour clock or a yyyyMMdd date format. - 請記住，自訂文化特性會覆寫預設值。Remember that custom cultures override default values. 因此，您不考慮穩定的文化特性資料。Therefore, you cannot consider culture data to be stable. 國家/地區名稱、 數字和日期格式，與拼字可能在未來變更。Country names, number and date formats, and spellings may change in the future. 如果您想要序列化區分文化特性的資料，例如日期和時間字串傳遞至日期和時間剖析函式，您應該使用而異的文化特性或特定。If you want to serialize culture-sensitive data such as date and time strings to be passed to the date and time parsing functions, you should use the invariant culture or a specific . 屬性值的自訂文化特性的系統上安裝包含指派旗標和自訂的文化特性屬性值為`LOCALE_CUSTOM_UNSPECIFIED`（0x1000 或 4096）。The property value of custom cultures installed on a system includes the flag, and custom cultures are assigned an property value of `LOCALE_CUSTOM_UNSPECIFIED` (0x1000, or 4096). 請注意，從 Windows 10 開始，這個值也已指派給系統定義的文化特性，缺少完整文化特性的資料。Note that, starting with Windows 10, this value is also assigned to system-defined cultures that lack complete cultural data. ## 動態的文化特性的資料Dynamic culture data 除了文化特性而異，文化特性的資料是動態的。Except for the invariant culture, culture data is dynamic. 這是即使的預先定義的文化特性，則為 true。This is true even for the predefined cultures. 例如，國家或地區採用新的貨幣、 變更及其拼字的單字，或變更慣用的曆法，和文化特性定義變更，以追蹤此。For example, countries or regions adopt new currencies, change their spellings of words, or change their preferred calendar, and culture definitions change to track this. 自訂文化特性恕不另行通知，而且可能會覆寫由取代自訂文化特性的任何特定的文化特性。Custom cultures are subject to change without notice, and any specific culture might be overridden by a custom replacement culture. 此外，如下所述，個別使用者可以覆寫文化喜好設定。Also, as discussed below, an individual user can override cultural preferences. 應用程式一律應在執行階段取得文化特性的資料。Applications should always obtain culture data at run time. > [!CAUTION] > 儲存資料時，您的應用程式應該使用文化特性而異，一種二進位格式或特定文化特性無關的格式。When saving data, your application should use the invariant culture, a binary format, or a specific culture-independent format. 根據特定文化特性以外文化特性而異，相關聯的目前值儲存資料可能會變成無法讀取，或該文化特性變更，可能會變更的意義。Data saved according to the current values associated with a particular culture, other than the invariant culture, might become unreadable or might change in meaning if that culture changes. ## 目前 UI 文化特性與目前的文化特性The current culture and current UI culture 在.NET Framework 應用程式中的每個執行緒有目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性。Every thread in a .NET Framework application has a current culture and a current UI culture. 目前的文化特性會決定日期、 時間、 數字和貨幣值、 文字、 大小寫慣例以及方式比較字串的排序次序的格式設定慣例。The current culture determines the formatting conventions for dates, times, numbers, and currency values, the sort order of text, casing conventions, and the ways in which strings are compared. 目前 UI 文化特性用來擷取在執行階段的特定文化特性的資源。The current UI culture is used to retrieve culture-specific resources at runtime. > [!NOTE] > 如需如何決定每個執行緒為基礎的目前和目前 UI 文化特性資訊，請參閱[文化特性和執行緒](#Threads)> 一節。For information on how the current and current UI culture is determined on a per-thread basis, see the [Culture and threads](#Threads) section. 如需目前與目前 UI 文化特性如何判斷在執行緒上執行新的應用程式定義域和執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限，請參閱[文化特性和應用程式定義域](#AppDomain)> 一節。For information on how the current and current UI culture is determined on threads executing in a new application domain, and on threads that cross application domain boundaries, see the [Culture and application domains](#AppDomain) section. 如需如何判斷目前和目前在執行工作為基礎的非同步作業的執行緒上的資訊，請參閱[文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業](#Async)> 一節。For information on how the current and current is determined on threads performing task-based asynchronous operations, see the [Culture and task-based asynchronous operations](#Async) section. 如需詳細的目前文化特性的詳細資訊，請參閱屬性主題。For more detailed information on the current culture, see the property topic. 如需詳細的目前 UI 文化特性的詳細資訊，請參閱屬性主題。For more detailed information on the current UI culture, see the property topic. ### 擷取目前和目前 UI 文化特性Retrieving the current and current UI cultures 您可以取得物件，代表目前的文化特性中任一種方式：You can get a object that represents the current culture in either of two ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. - 所擷取的值[Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture]()屬性。By retrieving the value of the [Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture]() property. 下列範例會擷取這兩個屬性值，比較它們，以顯示它們相等，以及顯示目前的文化特性的名稱。The following example retrieves both property values, compares them to show that they are equal, and displays the name of the current culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Globalization.CultureInfo/cs/Current1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Globalization.CultureInfo/vb/Current1.vb#1)] 您可以取得物件，代表目前 UI 文化特性，在兩種方法之一：You can get a object that represents the current UI culture in either of two ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. - 所擷取的值[Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture]()屬性。By retrieving the value of the [Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture]() property. 下列範例會擷取這兩個屬性值，比較它們，以顯示它們相等，以及顯示目前 UI 文化特性的名稱。The following example retrieves both property values, compares them to show that they are equal, and displays the name of the current UI culture. 也就是說，它們會建立預設文化特性的所有執行緒未明確指派都給特定應用程式定義域中的文化特性。 and are per-app domain properties; that is, they establish a default culture for all threads not explicitly assigned a culture in a specific application domain. 不過，如果目標的應用程式的[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]或更新版本中，會呼叫執行緒的文化特性持續非同步工作的內容的一部分，即使工作跨應用程式網域界限。However, for apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] or later, the culture of the calling thread remains part of an asynchronous task's context even if the task crosses app domain boundaries. 下列範例會示範呼叫執行緒的文化特性會持續以工作為基礎的非同步作業的目前文化特性，即使執行工作的方法會跨越應用程式定義域界限。The following example shows that the calling thread's culture remains the current culture of a task-based asynchronous operation even if the method that the task is executing crosses application domain boundaries. 它會定義一個類別， `DataRetriever`，具有單一方法， `GetFormattedNumber`，介於 1 到 1000 格式化為貨幣值傳回的隨機的雙精確度浮點數。It defines a class, `DataRetriever`, with a single method, `GetFormattedNumber`, that returns a random double-precision floating-point number between 1 and 1,000 formatted as a currency value. 第一個工作執行時，只會具現化`DataRetriever`執行個體並呼叫其`GetFormattedNumber`方法。A first task is run that simply instantiates a `DataRetriever` instance and calls its `GetFormattedNumber` method. 第二個工作會報告其目前的應用程式定義域、 建立新的應用程式定義域、 具現化`DataRetriever`執行個體中新的應用程式定義域，並呼叫其`GetFormattedNumber`方法。A second task reports its current application domain, creates a new application domain, instantiates a `DataRetriever` instance in the new application domain, and calls its `GetFormattedNumber` method. 範例輸出所示，目前的文化特性保持呼叫執行緒，第一項工作和第二個工作都在相同的主應用程式網域和第二個應用程式定義域中執行時。As the output from the example shows, the current culture has remained the same in the calling thread, the first task, and the second task both when it was executing in the main application domain and the second application domain. XP. 同樣地，如果在 Windows XP Service Pack 2 中引進的文化特性，不能夠還原序列化它的文化特性尚未安裝 Windows XP 系統。Similarly, if the culture was first introduced in Windows XP Service Pack 2, it is not possible to de-serialize it for a Windows XP system on which the culture has not been installed. - 如果值是，是還原序列化的電腦沒有安裝此使用者自訂文化特性，不可能將其還原序列化。If the value is , and the computer on which it is de-serialized does not have this user custom culture installed, it is not possible to de-serialize it. - 如果值是，並在其已還原序列化的電腦沒有此取代文化特性、 取消序列化至相同的名稱，但並不是全部相同的特性。If the value is , and the computer on which it is de-serialized does not have this replacement culture, it de-serializes to the same name, but not all of the same characteristics. 例如，如果 EN-US 是取代文化特性上的電腦，但不是能在電腦 B，且則參考此文化特性在電腦 A 上序列化和還原序列化在電腦 B 上都是自訂的文化特性的物件傳輸。For example, if en-US is a replacement culture on computer A, but not on computer B, and if a object referring to this culture is serialized on computer A and de-serialized on computer B, then none of the custom characteristics of the culture are transmitted. 文化特性會取消序列化成功，但有不同的意義。The culture de-serializes successfully, but with a different meaning. ## 控制台中會覆寫Control Panel overrides 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows 透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值不同的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 一般情況下，您的應用程式應該接受這些使用者覆寫。In general, your applications should honor these user overrides. 如果是`true`和指定的文化特性符合目前的文化特性的 Windows，會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個，未定義該方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. ## 替代排序次序Alternate sort orders 某些文化特性支援一個以上的排序次序。Some cultures support more than one sort order. 例如: For example: - 西班牙文 （西班牙） 文化特性都有兩個排序順序： 預設的國際排序順序，與傳統的排序順序。The Spanish (Spain) culture has two sort orders: the default international sort order, and the traditional sort order. 當您具現化ES-ES 文化特性名稱，物件會使用國際排序順序。When you instantiate a object with the es-ES culture name, the international sort order is used. 當您具現化es-ES-tradnl 文化特性名稱，物件會使用傳統的排序順序。When you instantiate a object with the es-ES-tradnl culture name, the traditional sort order is used. - ZH-CN （中文 （簡體，中國）） 文化特性支援兩個排序順序： 發音 （預設值） 和筆劃。The zh-CN (Chinese (Simplified, PRC)) culture supports two sort orders: by pronunciation (the default) and by stroke count. 當您具現化ZH-CN 文化特性名稱，物件會使用預設的排序順序。When you instantiate a object with the zh-CN culture name, the default sort order is used. 當您具現化物件的字串會排序筆劃 0x00020804，本機識別碼。When you instantiate a object with a local identifier of 0x00020804, strings are sorted by stroke count. 下表列出支援替代排序次序和識別項的預設和替代排序次序的文化特性。The following table lists the cultures that support alternate sort orders and the identifiers for the default and alternate sort orders. |文化特性名稱Culture name|cultureCulture|預設排序名稱和識別碼Default sort name and identifier|替代排序名稱和識別碼Alternate sort name and identifier| |------------------|-------------|--------------------------------------|----------------------------------------| |es-ESes-ES|西班牙文 （西班牙）Spanish (Spain)|國際： 0x00000C0AInternational: 0x00000C0A|傳統： 0x0000040ATraditional: 0x0000040A| |zh-TWzh-TW|中文 （台灣）Chinese (Taiwan)|筆劃數： 0x00000404Stroke Count: 0x00000404|注音符號： 0x00030404Bopomofo: 0x00030404| |zh-CNzh-CN|中文 （中國）Chinese (PRC)|發音： 0x00000804Pronunciation: 0x00000804|筆劃數： 0x00020804Stroke Count: 0x00020804| |zh-HKzh-HK|中文 （香港特別行政區）Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)|筆劃數： 0x00000c04Stroke Count: 0x00000c04|筆劃數： 0x00020c04Stroke Count: 0x00020c04| |zh-SGzh-SG|中文 （新加坡）Chinese (Singapore)|發音： 0x00001004Pronunciation: 0x00001004|筆劃數： 0x00021004Stroke Count: 0x00021004| |zh-chs 和 MOzh-MO|中文 （澳門特別行政區）Chinese (Macao SAR)|發音： 0x00001404Pronunciation: 0x00001404|筆劃數： 0x00021404Stroke Count: 0x00021404| |ja-JPja-JP|日文 （日本）Japanese (Japan)|預設： 0x00000411Default: 0x00000411|Unicode: 0x00010411Unicode: 0x00010411| |ko-KRko-KR|韓文 （韓國）Korean (Korea)|預設： 0x00000412Default: 0x00000412|韓文 Xwansung-Unicode: 0x00010412Korean Xwansung - Unicode: 0x00010412| |de-DEde-DE|德文 （德國）German (Germany)|字典： 0x00000407Dictionary: 0x00000407|電話簿排序 DIN: 0x00010407Phone Book Sort DIN: 0x00010407| |hu HUhu-HU|匈牙利文 （匈牙利）Hungarian (Hungary)|預設： 0x0000040eDefault: 0x0000040e|技術排序： 0x0001040eTechnical Sort: 0x0001040e| |ka GEka-GE|喬治亞文 （喬治亞）Georgian (Georgia)|傳統： 0x00000437Traditional: 0x00000437|現代排序： 0x00010437Modern Sort: 0x00010437| ## 目前的文化特性和 UWP 應用程式The current culture and UWP apps 在通用 Windows 平台 (UWP) 應用程式，和屬性是讀寫，就如同它們在.NET Framework 和.NET 核心應用程式中。In Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, the and properties are read-write, just as they are in .NET Framework and .NET Core apps. 不過，UWP 應用程式辨識單一文化特性。However, UWP apps recognize a single culture. 和屬性對應中的第一個值[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合。The and properties map to the first value in the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection. 在.NET Framework 和.NET 核心應用程式，目前的文化特性是每個執行緒設定，而和屬性會反映的文化特性和 UI 文化特性只有目前的執行緒。In .NET Framework and .NET Core apps, the current culture is a per-thread setting, and the and properties reflect the culture and UI culture of the current thread only. 在 UWP 應用程式，目前的文化特性都對應到[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合的全域設定。In UWP apps, the current culture maps to the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection, which is a global setting. 設定或屬性變更整個應用程式的文化特性，則無法設定每個執行緒為基礎的文化特性。Setting the or property changes the culture of the entire app; culture cannot be set on a per-thread basis. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何建立西班牙文 （西班牙） 與國際排序，而另一個物件具有傳統排序物件。The following example shows how to create a object for Spanish (Spain) with the international sort and another object with the traditional sort. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/CPP/spanishspain.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/CS/spanishspain.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/VB/spanishspain.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 預先定義的文化特性識別項所列的是[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global 開發人員中心。Predefined culture identifiers are listed in the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 在大部分情況下，`culture`參數對應到相對應的國家語言支援 (NLS) 地區設定識別碼。In most cases, the `culture` parameter is mapped to the corresponding National Language Support (NLS) locale identifier. 值`culture`參數的值就會變成屬性的新。The value of the `culture` parameter becomes the value of the property of the new . 我們建議您呼叫的地區設定名稱建構函式，因為地區設定名稱則偏好的 Lcid。We recommend that you call the locale name constructor , because locale names are preferable to LCIDs. 自訂地區設定，地區設定名稱是必要的。For custom locales, a locale name is required. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows 透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值不同的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果指定的文化特性識別項符合目前的 Windows 文化特性的文化特性識別項，這個建構函式會建立使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If the specified culture identifier matches the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a that uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容(例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個) 會定義該方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the (for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the ) the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 如果指定的文化特性識別項不符合目前的 Windows 文化特性識別項，這個建構函式會建立指定文化特性使用的預設值。If the specified culture identifier does not match the identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a that uses the default values for the specified culture. 屬性一定會設定為`true`。The property is always set to `true`. 例如，假設阿拉伯文 （沙烏地阿拉伯） 是目前的 Windows 文化特性，而且使用者已變更從回曆曆法為西曆。For example, suppose that Arabic (Saudi Arabia) is the current Windows culture and the user has changed the calendar from Hijri to Gregorian. - 與`CultureInfo("0x0401")`（文化特性名稱 AR-SA）設（此為使用者設定） 和設`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x0401")` (culture name ar-SA), is set to (which is the user setting) and is set to `true`. - 與`CultureInfo("0x041E")`（文化特性名稱的第個），設（此為預設的行事曆的第個） 和設`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x041E")` (culture name th-TH), is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `true`. 使用歐元的文化特性，.NET Framework 和 Windows XP 會設定預設貨幣以歐元。For cultures that use the euro, the .NET Framework and Windows XP set the default currency as euro. 不過，舊版的 Windows 則否。However, older versions of Windows do not. 因此，如果較舊版本的 Windows 使用者沒有變更貨幣設定，透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分，貨幣可能不正確。Therefore, if the user of an older version of Windows has not changed the currency setting through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel, the currency might be incorrect. 若要使用之貨幣的.NET Framework 的預設設定，應用程式應該使用建構函式多載接受`useUserOverride`參數並將它設定為`false`。To use the .NET Framework default setting for the currency, the application should use a constructor overload that accepts a `useUserOverride` parameter and set it to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 為回溯相容性，使用建構的文化特性`culture`0x0004 或 0x7c04 參數會有屬性的 zh-chs 和 ZH-CHT，分別。For backwards compatibility, a culture constructed using a `culture` parameter of 0x0004 or 0x7c04 will have a property of zh-CHS or zh-CHT, respectively. 您應該改為想要建構的文化特性使用的 zh-chs 和 Hans 或 zh-chs 和 Hant，目前的標準的文化特性名稱，除非您有使用較舊名稱的原因。You should instead prefer to construct the culture using the current standard culture names of zh-Hans or zh-Hant, unless you have a reason for using the older names.

Starting with apps that run under the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] or later on Windows 7 or later, the method attempts to retrieve a object whose identifier is from the operating system; if the operating system does not support that culture, the method throws a exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如需預先定義的文化特性名稱的清單，請參閱[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global 開發人員中心。For a list of predefined culture names, see the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 此外，開頭為 Windows 10`name`可以是任何有效的 bcp-47 語言標記。In addition, starting with Windows 10, `name` can be any valid BCP-47 language tag. 如果`name`是，建構函式會建立執行個體的文化特性而異; 這相當於擷取的值屬性。If `name` is , the constructor creates an instance of the invariant culture; this is equivalent to retrieving the value of the property. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows 透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值不同的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果相關聯的文化特性識別碼`name`相符項目目前的 Windows 文化特性，這個建構函式的文化特性識別項建立物件，使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If the culture identifier associated with `name` matches the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a object that uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個，未定義該方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 如果相關聯的文化特性識別碼`name`不的符合目前的 Windows 文化特性，這個建構函式的文化特性識別項建立指定文化特性會使用預設值的物件。If the culture identifier associated with `name` does not match the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a object that uses the default values for the specified culture. 屬性一定會設定為`true`。The property is always set to `true`. 例如，假設阿拉伯文 （沙烏地阿拉伯） 是目前的文化特性的 Windows，而且使用者從回曆曆法變更為西曆。For example, suppose that Arabic (Saudi Arabia) is the current culture of Windows and the user changed the calendar from Hijri to Gregorian. - 與`CultureInfo("ar-SA")`，設（此為使用者設定） 和設`true`。With `CultureInfo("ar-SA")`, is set to (which is the user setting) and is set to `true`. - 與`CultureInfo("th-TH")`，設（此為預設的行事曆的第個） 和設`true`。With `CultureInfo("th-TH")`, is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `true`. 屬性的新設為具有指定名稱相關聯的文化特性識別項。The property of the new is set to the culture identifier associated with the specified name. 使用歐元的文化特性，.NET Framework 和 Windows XP 會設定預設貨幣以歐元。For cultures that use the euro, the .NET Framework and Windows XP set the default currency as euro. 不過，舊版的 Windows 不這樣做。However, older versions of Windows do not do this. 因此，如果較舊版本的 Windows 使用者沒有變更貨幣設定，透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分，貨幣可能不正確。Therefore, if the user of an older version of Windows has not changed the currency setting through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel, the currency might be incorrect. 若要使用之貨幣的.NET Framework 的預設設定，應用程式應該使用建構函式多載接受`useUserOverride`參數並將它設定為`false`。To use the .NET Framework default setting for the currency, the application should use a constructor overload that accepts a `useUserOverride` parameter and set it to `false`. ## Examples 下列範例會擷取目前的文化特性。The following example retrieves the current culture. 如果是法文 （法國） 文化特性以外的任何項目，它會呼叫建構函式來具現化代表法文 （法國） 文化特性，並使其成為目前執行緒文化特性的物件。If it is anything other than the French (France) culture, it calls the constructor to instantiate a object that represents the French (France) culture and makes it the current thread culture. 否則，它會具現化代表法文 （盧森堡） 文化特性，並使其成為目前的文化特性的物件。Otherwise, it instantiates a object that represents the French (Luxembourg) culture and makes it the current culture. Starting with apps that run under the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] or later on Windows 7 or later, the method attempts to retrieve a object whose identifier is from the operating system; if the operating system does not support that culture, and if is not the name of a supplementary or replacement culture, the method throws a exception.

Support (NLS) API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 在大部分情況下，`culture`參數對應到相對應的國家語言支援 (NLS) 地區設定識別碼。In most cases, the `culture` parameter is mapped to the corresponding National Language Support (NLS) locale identifier. 值`culture`參數的值就會變成屬性的新。The value of the `culture` parameter becomes the value of the property of the new . 我們建議您呼叫的地區設定名稱建構函式，因為地區設定名稱則偏好的 Lcid。We recommend that you call the locale name constructor , because locale names are preferable to LCIDs. 自訂地區設定，地區設定名稱是必要的。For custom locales, a locale name is required. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows 透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值不同的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 應用程式應該通常不允許使用者覆寫。Applications should typically not disallow user overrides. 請注意，不允許覆寫不保證資料的穩定性。請參閱部落格文章：[文化特性的資料不應視為穩定 （除了，非變異）](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=156850)。Note that disallowing overrides does not itself guarantee data stability; see the blog entry [Culture data shouldn't be considered stable (except for Invariant)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=156850). 如果屬性設定為`true`和指定的文化特性識別項符合目前的 Windows 文化特性識別項，這個建構函式會建立使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定的屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If the property is set to `true` and the specified culture identifier matches the identifier of the current Windows culture, this constructor creates a that uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個，未定義該方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 否則，這個建構函式會建立指定文化特性使用的預設值。Otherwise, this constructor creates a that uses the default values for the specified culture. 值`useUserOverride`參數的值就會變成屬性。The value of the `useUserOverride` parameter becomes the value of the property. 例如，假設阿拉伯文 （沙烏地阿拉伯） 是目前的文化特性的 Windows，而且使用者已變更從回曆曆法為西曆。For example, suppose that Arabic (Saudi Arabia) is the current culture of Windows and the user has changed the calendar from Hijri to Gregorian. - 與`CultureInfo("0x0401", true)`（文化特性名稱 AR-SA）設（此為使用者設定） 和設`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x0401", true)` (culture name ar-SA), is set to (which is the user setting) and is set to `true`. - 與`CultureInfo("0x0401", false)`（文化特性名稱 AR-SA）設（此為預設的行事曆的 AR-SA） 和設`false`。With `CultureInfo("0x0401", false)` (culture name ar-SA), is set to (which is the default calendar for ar-SA) and is set to `false`. - 與`CultureInfo("0x041E", true)`（文化特性名稱的第個），設（此為預設的行事曆的第個） 和設`true`。With `CultureInfo("0x041E", true)` (culture name th-TH), is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `true`. - 與`CultureInfo("0x041E", false)`（文化特性名稱的第個），設（此為預設的行事曆的第個） 和設`false`。With `CultureInfo("0x041E", false)` (culture name th-TH), is set to (which is the default calendar for th-TH) and is set to `false`. 使用歐元的文化特性，.NET Framework 和 Windows XP 會設定預設貨幣以歐元。For cultures that use the euro, the .NET Framework and Windows XP set the default currency as euro. 不過，舊版的 Windows 則否。However, older versions of Windows do not. 因此，如果較舊版本的 Windows 使用者沒有變更貨幣設定，透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分，貨幣可能不正確。Therefore, if the user of an older version of Windows has not changed the currency setting through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel, the currency might be incorrect. 若要使用之貨幣的.NET Framework 的預設設定，應用程式應該設定`useUserOverride`參數`false`。To use the .NET Framework default setting for the currency, the application should set the `useUserOverride` parameter to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 為回溯相容性，使用建構的文化特性`culture`0x0004 或 0x7c04 參數會有屬性的 zh-chs 和 ZH-CHT，分別。For backwards compatibility, a culture constructed using a `culture` parameter of 0x0004 or 0x7c04 will have a property of zh-CHS or zh-CHT, respectively. 您應該改為想要建構的文化特性使用的 zh-chs 和 Hans 或 zh-chs 和 Hant，目前的標準的文化特性名稱，除非您有使用較舊名稱的原因。You should instead prefer to construct the culture using the current standard culture names of zh-Hans or zh-Hant, unless you have a reason for using the older names.

span.span: Refreshes cached culture-related information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 第一次要求快取資訊，例如預設文化特性及格式模式。Information, such as the default culture and format patterns, is cached the first time it is requested. 存留期間，可以變更資訊，比方說，當使用者修改控制台中的 地區及語言選項部分。That information can change during the life of the , for example, when the user modifies the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 不過，類別不會自動偵測變更系統設定中。However, the class does not automatically detect changes in the system settings. 方法清除的快取所建立的物件並重新整理中的資訊， ，和根據目前的系統設定的屬性。The method clears the cache of objects created by and refreshes the information in the , , and properties, based on the current system settings. 方法不會重新整理中的資訊現有的執行緒屬性。The method does not refresh the information in the property for existing threads. 不過，未來的執行緒會有任何新屬性值。However, future threads will have any new property values.

summary.span: 建立目前的 複本。

span.span: Creates a copy of the current .
A copy of the current .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 複製為可寫入即使原始處於唯讀狀態。The clone is writable even if the original is read-only. 因此，您可修改複製品的屬性。Therefore, the properties of the clone can be modified. 物件的淺層複本是只是物件的副本。A shallow copy of an object is a copy of the object only. 如果物件包含其他物件的參考，則淺層複製不會建立參考物件的複本。If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy does not create copies of the referred objects. 它改為參考原始物件。It refers to the original objects instead. 相較之下，物件的複本，以及該物件直接或間接參考的所有項目會建立物件的深層複本。In contrast, a deep copy of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object. 方法會建立增強的淺層複本。The method creates an enhanced shallow copy. 所傳回的物件， ， ，和也會複製屬性。The objects returned by the , , , and properties are also copied. 因此，複製物件可以修改其複製的內容，而不會影響原始物件。Consequently, the cloned object can modify its copied properties without affecting the original object. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範 CultureInfo.Clone 也複製和與相關聯的執行個體。The following code example shows that CultureInfo.Clone also clones the and instances associated with the . [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone/CPP/yslin_cultureinfo_clone.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone/CS/yslin_cultureinfo_clone.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone/VB/yslin_cultureinfo_clone.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會傳回提供區分文化特性的排序和字串比較作業中使用的特定文化特性資訊的物件。The property returns a object that provides culture-specific information used in culture-sensitive sorting and string comparison operations. 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows 透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值不同的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果是`true`和指定的文化特性符合目前的文化特性的 Windows，會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個，未定義該方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何建立西班牙文 （西班牙） 與國際排序，而另一個與傳統排序。The following code example shows how to create a for Spanish (Spain) with the international sort and another with the traditional sort. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/CPP/spanishspain.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/CS/spanishspain.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo_esES/VB/spanishspain.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會包裝呼叫建構函式。The method wraps a call to the constructor. > [!NOTE] > 如需預先定義的文化特性名稱的清單，請參閱[國家語言支援 (NLS) API 參考](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在 Go Global 開發人員中心。For a list of predefined culture names, see the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 此外，開頭為 Windows 10`name`可以是任何有效的 bcp-47 語言標記。In addition, starting with Windows 10, `name` can be any valid BCP-47 language tag. 文化特性分為三個集合： 而異的文化特性、 中性文化特性和特定文化特性。Cultures are grouped into three sets: the invariant culture, the neutral cultures, and the specific cultures. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱描述類別。For more information, see the description of the class. 如果這個方法所傳回的特定文化特性的文化特性識別項符合目前的 Windows 文化特性的文化特性識別項，這個方法會建立使用 Windows 文化特性的物件會覆寫。If the culture identifier of the specific culture returned by this method matches the culture identifier of the current Windows culture, this method creates a object that uses the Windows culture overrides. 覆寫中包含之屬性的使用者設定所傳回物件屬性和所傳回物件屬性。The overrides include user settings for the properties of the object returned by the property and the object returned by the property. 具現化物件，使用預設的文化特性設定而非使用者覆寫時，呼叫建構函式，其值為`false`如`useUserOverride`引數。To instantiate a object that with default culture settings rather than user overrides, call the constructor with a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. 雖然方法名稱包含 「 特定 」 一詞，請記住，文化特性的資料可以變更之間的版本中，或因為自訂文化特性，或因為使用者覆寫。Although the method name includes the term "Specific", remember that culture data can change between versions, or due to custom cultures, or because of user overrides. 用於儲存資料而異的文化特性或二進位或固定的表單。Use the invariant culture or binary or fixed forms for saving data. ## Examples 下列範例會擷取陣列物件以代表中性文化特性，從方法，並排序陣列。The following example retrieves an array of objects that represent neutral cultures from the method and sorts the array. 時，它會逐一查看陣列中的項目，它會傳遞至每個中性文化特性名稱方法，並顯示由方法傳回的特定文化特性的名稱。When it iterates the elements in the array, it passes the name of each neutral culture to the method and displays the name of the specific culture returned by the method. > [!NOTE] > 此範例會使用 ZH-CHS 和 ZH-CHT 文化特性名稱。The example uses the zh-CHS and zh-CHT culture names. 不過，針對 Windows Vista 和更新版本應該使用而非 ZH-CHS 和 zh-chs 和-Hant 而不是 zh-chs 和 ZH-CHT zh-chs 和 Hans 應用程式。However, applications that target Windows Vista and later should use zh-Hans instead of zh-CHS and zh-Hant instead of zh-CHT. zh-chs 和 Hans 和 zh-chs 和 Hant 代表目前的標準，應該使用，除非您有使用較舊名稱的原因。zh-Hans and zh-Hant represent the current standard and should be used unless you have a reason for using the older names. > > 請注意，範例的結果可能在其中輸入的是中文 （繁體） 中性文化特性 （zh-chs 和、 zh-chs 和 ZH-CHT 或 zh-chs 和 Hant） 會傳回 ZH-TW 的繁體中文 Windows 安裝上，而有所不同。Note also that the results of the example may differ on an installation of Taiwanese Windows, where the input of a Chinese (Traditional) neutral culture (zh, zh-CHT, or zh-Hant) will return zh-TW. summary.span: 取得或設定 物件，這個物件代表目前執行緒使用的文化特性。

span.span: Gets or sets the object that represents the culture used by the current thread.

value.span: 物件，代表目前執行緒使用的文化特性。

span.span: An object that represents the culture used by the current thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性所傳回的物件和其相關聯的物件決定預設格式的日期、 時間、 數字、 貨幣值，排序順序的文字、 大小寫慣例，以及字串比較。The object that is returned by this property and its associated objects determine the default format for dates, times, numbers, currency values, the sorting order of text, casing conventions, and string comparisons. 目前的文化特性是執行的執行緒，這所傳回的靜態屬性屬性。The current culture is a property of the executing thread, which is returned by the static property. 值屬性會對應至值屬性。The value of the property corresponds to the value of the property. 擷取的值屬性就相當於擷取所傳回物件`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性。Retrieving the value of the property is equivalent to retrieving the object returned by the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，設定的值屬性也會變更目前執行緒文化特性。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], setting the value of the property also changes the current thread culture. > [!NOTE] > 在.NET Framework 4.5.2 及更新版本、屬性是唯讀的。 也就是您可以擷取屬性值，但您無法設定它。In the .NET Framework 4.5.2 and earlier versions, the property is read-only; that is, you can retrieve the property value, but you cannot set it. 若要變更目前的文化特性，您指派物件，表示新的文化特性`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性。To change the current culture, you assign the object that represents the new culture to the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]、屬性是讀寫，則您可以同時設定及擷取屬性的值。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the property is read-write; you can both set and retrieve the property's value. 如果您設定屬性值物件，表示新的文化特性的值`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性也會變更。If you do set the property value to a object that represents a new culture, the value of the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property also changes. 本節內容：In this section: [如何判斷執行緒的文化特性](#ThreadCulture) [How a Thread's Culture Is Determined](#ThreadCulture) [取得目前的文化特性](#Getting) [Getting the Current Culture](#Getting) [明確設定 CurrentCulture 屬性](#ExplicitSetting) [Explicitly Setting the CurrentCulture Property](#ExplicitSetting) [目前的文化特性和使用者覆寫](#Overrides) [The Current Culture and User Overrides](#Overrides) [文化特性和 Windows 應用程式Culture and Windows Apps](#WindowsAndCurr) ## 如何判斷執行緒的文化特性How a Thread's Culture Is Determined 在執行緒啟動時，其文化特性是一開始決定，如下所示：When a thread is started, its culture is initially determined as follows: - 藉由擷取所指定的文化特性屬性中的執行緒正在執行，如果屬性值不是應用程式定義域中`null`。By retrieving the culture that is specified by the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing, if the property value is not `null`. - 如果執行緒正在執行的工作為基礎的非同步作業和應用程式的目標在執行緒集區執行緒[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]或更新版本的.NET Framework 中，其文化特性由呼叫執行緒的文化特性。If the thread is a thread pool thread that is executing a task-based asynchronous operation and the app targets the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] or a later version of the .NET Framework, its culture is determined by the culture of the calling thread. 下列範例將目前的文化特性變更為葡萄牙文 （巴西），並啟動六個工作，其中每個顯示其執行緒 ID、 其工作識別碼，以及其目前的文化特性。The following example changes the current culture to Portuguese (Brazil) and launches six tasks, each of which displays its thread ID, its task ID, and its current culture. 每個工作 （和執行緒） 已繼承呼叫執行緒的文化特性。Each of the tasks (and the threads) has inherited the culture of the calling thread. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/Async1.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/Async1.vb#14)] 如需詳細資訊，請參閱中的 < 文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業 」 一節主題。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section in the topic. - 藉由呼叫 Windows`GetUserDefaultLocaleName`函式。By calling the Windows `GetUserDefaultLocaleName` function. 請注意，是否您設定不同的系統安裝的文化特性或使用者的慣用文化特性特定文化特性，且應用程式啟動多個執行緒，這些執行緒的目前文化特性，將會所傳回的文化特性`GetUserDefaultLocaleName`函式，除非您指定的文化特性執行緒正在執行的應用程式定義域中的屬性。Note that if you set a specific culture that is different from the system-installed culture or the user's preferred culture, and your application starts multiple threads, the current culture of those threads will be the culture that is returned by the `GetUserDefaultLocaleName` function, unless you assign a culture to the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing. 如需有關如何判斷執行緒的文化特性的詳細資訊，請參閱中的 < 文化特性和執行緒 > 一節參考頁面。For more information about how the culture of a thread is determined, see the "Culture and threads" section in the reference page. ## 取得目前的文化特性Getting the Current Culture 屬性是每個執行緒設定; 也就是每個執行緒可以有它自己的文化特性。The property is a per-thread setting; that is, each thread can have its own culture. 您所擷取的值取得目前執行緒的文化特性屬性，如下列範例說明。You get the culture of the current thread by retrieving the value of the property, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/Get1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/Get1.vb#5)] 您也可以擷取從目前執行緒的文化特性值屬性。You can also retrieve the value of the current thread's culture from the property. ## 明確設定 CurrentCulture 屬性Explicitly Setting the CurrentCulture Property 從[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，來變更現有的執行緒，使用的文化特性設定新的文化特性的屬性。Staring with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], to change the culture that is used by an existing thread, you set the property to the new culture. 如果您明確地變更執行緒的文化特性變更如此一來，如果執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限會保存。If you explicitly change a thread's culture in this way, that change persists if the thread crosses application domain boundaries. 下列範例會變更目前執行緒文化特性為荷蘭文 （荷蘭）。The following example changes the current thread culture to Dutch (Netherlands). 它也會顯示，當目前的執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限，其目前的文化特性會維持已變更。It also shows that, when the current thread crosses application domain boundaries, its current culture remains changed. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/changeculture11.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/changeculture11.vb#11)] > [!NOTE] > 變更文化特性使用屬性需要具有權限值的設定。Changing the culture by using the property requires a permission with the value set. 操作執行緒有危險，因為與執行緒相關聯的安全性狀態。Manipulating threads is dangerous because of the security state associated with threads. 因此，此權限應該授與然後必要時，才給可靠的程式碼。Therefore, this permission should be given only to trustworthy code, and then only as necessary. 您無法變更非完全信任的程式碼中的執行緒文化特性。You cannot change thread culture in semi-trusted code. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，您可以明確地變更目前執行緒文化特性 （例如，法文 （加拿大）） 的特定文化特性或中性文化特性 （例如，法文）。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], you can explicitly change the current thread culture to either a specific culture (such as French (Canada)) or a neutral culture (such as French). 當物件都代表中性文化特性的值屬性，例如， ， ， ，和反映相關聯的特定文化特性中性文化特性。When a object represents a neutral culture, the values of properties such as , , , , and reflect the specific culture that is associated with the neutral culture. 例如，英文的中性文化特性的基準文化特性是英文 （美國）;主控項的文化特性，德文文化特性是德文 （德國）。For example, the dominant culture for the English neutral culture is English (United States); the dominant culture for the German culture is German (Germany). 下列範例說明格式化當目前的文化特性設定為特定的文化特性、 法文 （加拿大） 和中性文化特性，差異法文。The following example illustrates the difference in formatting when the current culture is set to a specific culture, French (Canada), and a neutral culture, French. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/specific12.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/specific12.vb#12)] 您也可以使用屬性連同屬性來設定屬性的 ASP.NET 應用程式給使用者的慣用文化特性，如下列範例所示。You can also use the property along with the property to set the property of an ASP.NET application to the user's preferred culture, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/cs/aspculture13.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentculture/vb/aspculture13.vb#13)] ## 目前的文化特性和使用者覆寫The Current Culture and User Overrides Windows 允許使用者覆寫的標準屬性值物件和其相關聯的物件，使用**地區及語言選項**控制台 中。Windows allows users to override the standard property values of the object and its associated objects by using **Regional and Language Options** in Control Panel. 所傳回物件屬性會反映這些使用者覆寫在下列情況：The object returned by the property reflects these user overrides in the following cases: - 如果目前執行緒文化特性隱含謔 Windows 廑飶`GetUserDefaultLocaleName`函式。If the current thread culture is set implicitly by the Windows `GetUserDefaultLocaleName` function. - 如果目前執行緒文化特性所定義屬性會對應至目前的 Windows 系統文化特性。If the current thread culture defined by the property corresponds to the current Windows system culture. - 如果目前執行緒文化特性設定明確地為所傳回的文化特性方法和文化特性與目前的 Windows 系統文化特性。If the current thread culture is set explicitly to a culture returned by the method, and that culture corresponds to the current Windows system culture. - 如果目前執行緒文化特性設明確具現化的文化特性建構函式，和文化特性與目前的 Windows 系統文化特性。If the current thread culture is set explicitly to a culture instantiated by the constructor, and that culture corresponds to the current Windows system culture. 在某些情況下，特別是針對伺服器應用程式，將目前的文化特性設定為反映使用者覆寫的物件可能會讓人困擾。In some cases, particularly for server applications, setting the current culture to a object that reflects user overrides may be undesirable. 相反地，您可以將目前執行緒文化特性設定為並不會反映使用者的物件會覆寫以下列方式：Instead, you can set the current thread culture to a object that does not reflect user overrides in the following ways: - 藉由呼叫建構函式，其值為`false`如`useUserOverride`引數。By calling the constructor with a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. - 藉由呼叫方法，這個方法會傳回快取、 唯讀物件。By calling the method, which returns a cached, read-only object. ## 目前的文化特性和 UWP 應用程式The current culture and UWP apps 在通用 Windows 平台 (UWP) 應用程式，屬性是讀寫，就如同它是在.NET Framework 和.NET 核心應用程式中，您可以使用它來取得和設定目前的文化特性。In Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, the property is read-write, just as it is in .NET Framework and .NET Core apps; you can use it both to get and to set the current culture. 不過，UWP 應用程式不會區分目前文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性。However, UWP apps do not distinguish between the current culture and the current UI culture. 和屬性對應中的第一個值[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合。The and properties map to the first value in the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection. 在.NET Framework 和.NET 核心應用程式，目前的文化特性是每個執行緒設定，而屬性會反映目前執行緒的文化特性。In .NET Framework and .NET Core apps, the current culture is a per-thread setting, and the property reflects the culture of the current thread only. 在 UWP 應用程式，目前的文化特性都對應到[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)屬性，這是全域設定。In UWP apps, the current culture maps to the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) property, which is a global setting. 設定屬性變更整個應用程式的文化特性，則無法設定每個執行緒為基礎的文化特性。Setting the property changes the culture of the entire app; culture cannot be set on a per-thread basis. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何變更和目前執行緒。The following example demonstrates how to change the and of the current thread. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CPP/currentculture.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CS/currentculture.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/VB/currentculture.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 目前 UI 文化特性是每個執行緒屬性。The current UI culture is a per-thread property. 也就是說，每個執行緒有它自己的目前 UI 文化特性。That is, each thread has its own current UI culture. 這個屬性就相當於擷取，或開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，設定物件指派給`System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture`屬性。This property is equivalent to retrieving or, starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], setting the object assigned to the `System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture` property. 在執行緒啟動時，它的 UI 文化特性是一開始決定，如下所示：When a thread is started, its UI culture is initially determined as follows: - 藉由擷取所指定的文化特性屬性中的執行緒正在執行，如果屬性值不是應用程式定義域中`null`。By retrieving the culture that is specified by the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing, if the property value is not `null`. - 如果執行緒正在執行的工作為基礎的非同步作業和應用程式的目標在執行緒集區執行緒[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]或更新版本的.NET Framework 中，其 UI 文化特性由呼叫執行緒的 UI 文化特性。If the thread is a thread pool thread that is executing a task-based asynchronous operation and the app targets the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] or a later version of the .NET Framework, its UI culture is determined by the UI culture of the calling thread. 下列範例將目前的 UI 文化特性變更為葡萄牙文 （巴西），並啟動六個工作，其中每個顯示其執行緒 ID、 其工作識別碼，以及其目前的 UI 文化特性。The following example changes the current UI culture to Portuguese (Brazil) and launches six tasks, each of which displays its thread ID, its task ID, and its current UI culture. 每個工作 （和執行緒） 已繼承呼叫執行緒的 UI 文化特性。Each of the tasks (and the threads) has inherited the UI culture of the calling thread. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/cs/Async1.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/vb/Async1.vb#14)] 如需詳細資訊，請參閱中的 < 文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業 」 一節主題。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section in the topic. - 藉由呼叫 Windows`GetUserDefaultUILanguage`函式。By calling the Windows `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` function. > [!NOTE] > 在[!INCLUDE[Compact](~/includes/compact-md.md)]、屬性是唯讀的。In the [!INCLUDE[Compact](~/includes/compact-md.md)], the property is read-only. 目前 UI 文化特性由系統的地區設定決定，而且不能以程式設計方式變更。The current UI culture is determined by the system's regional settings and cannot be changed programmatically. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，若要變更的使用者介面文化特性使用的執行緒，設定新的文化特性的屬性。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], to change the user interface culture used by a thread, set the property to the new culture. 如果您明確地變更執行緒的 UI 文化特性變更如此一來，如果執行緒跨越應用程式定義域界限會保存。If you explicitly change a thread's UI culture in this way, that change persists if the thread crosses application domain boundaries. > [!NOTE] > 在.NET Framework 4.5.2 及更新版本、屬性是唯讀的。 也就是您可以擷取屬性值，但您無法設定它。In the .NET Framework 4.5.2 and earlier versions, the property is read-only; that is, you can retrieve the property value, but you cannot set it. 若要變更的目前 UI 文化特性，您指派物件，代表要新的 UI 文化特性`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture`屬性。To change the current UI culture, you assign the object that represents the new UI culture to the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture` property. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]、屬性是讀寫，則您可以同時設定及擷取屬性的值。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the property is read-write; you can both set and retrieve the property's value. 如果您設定屬性值物件，表示新的文化特性的值`Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture`屬性也會變更。If you do set the property value to a object that represents a new culture, the value of the `Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture` property also changes. 本節內容：In this section: [取得目前 UI 文化特性](#Getting) [Getting the Current UI Culture](#Getting) [明確地將目前的 UI 文化特性設定](#Explicit) [Explicitly Setting the Current UI Culture](#Explicit) [隱含設定目前 UI 文化特性](#Implicit) [Implicitly Setting the Current UI Culture](#Implicit) [安全性考量](#Security) [Security Considerations](#Security) [目前的 UI 文化特性和 Windows 應用程式The Current UI Culture and Windows apps](#WindowsAndCurrUI) ## 取得目前 UI 文化特性Getting the Current UI Culture 屬性是每個執行緒設定; 也就是每個執行緒可以有它自己的 UI 文化特性。The property is a per-thread setting; that is, each thread can have its own UI culture. 您所擷取的值取得目前執行緒的 UI 文化特性屬性，如下列範例說明。You get the UI culture of the current thread by retrieving the value of the property, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/cs/Get1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/vb/Get1.vb#5)] 您也可以擷取從目前的執行緒 UI 文化特性值屬性。You can also retrieve the value of the current thread's UI culture from the property. ## 明確地將目前的 UI 文化特性設定Explicitly Setting the Current UI Culture 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，您可以藉由指派變更的目前 UI 文化特性物件，表示新的文化特性屬性。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], you can change the current UI culture by assigning a object that represents the new culture to the property. 可能是特定文化特性 （例如 EN-US 或 DE-DE） 或中性文化特性 （例如 en-us 或 de），則可以設定的目前 UI 文化特性。The current UI culture can be set to either a specific culture (such as en-US or de-DE) or to a neutral culture (such as en or de). 下列範例會設定為 FR-FR 或法文 （法國） 的目前 UI 文化特性。The following example sets the current UI culture to fr-FR or French (France). [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/cs/currentuiculture1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.currentuiculture/vb/currentuiculture1.vb#1)] 在多執行緒應用程式中，您可以明確地設定 UI 文化特性的任何執行緒指派物件，代表在執行緒的文化特性的屬性。In a multithreaded application, you can explicitly set the UI culture of any thread by assigning a object that represents that culture to the thread's property. 如果您想要設定其文化的特性是目前的執行緒，您可以指派新的文化特性屬性。If the thread whose culture you want to set is the current thread, you can assign the new culture to the property. 當執行緒 UI 文化特性已明確設定，即使它跨越應用程式定義域界限與其他應用程式定義域中執行程式碼的執行緒會保留相同的文化特性。When the UI culture of a thread is set explicitly, that thread retains the same culture even if it crosses application domain boundaries and executes code in another application domain. ## 隱含設定目前 UI 文化特性Implicitly Setting the Current UI Culture 當執行緒，包括主應用程式執行緒，第一個，依預設會建立其目前的 UI 文化特性設定，如下所示：When a thread, including the main application thread, is first created, by default its current UI culture is set as follows: - 使用所定義的文化特性屬性目前的應用程式定義域的屬性值不是如果`null`。By using the culture defined by the property for the current application domain if the property value is not `null`. - 使用系統的預設文化特性。By using the system's default culture. 在系統上使用 Windows 作業系統，common language runtime 會呼叫 Windows`GetUserDefaultUILanguage`函式可設定的目前 UI 文化特性。On systems that use the Windows operating system, the common language runtime calls the Windows `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` function to set the current UI culture. `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` 傳回使用者所設定的預設 UI 文化特性。`GetUserDefaultUILanguage` returns the default UI culture set by the user. 如果使用者未設定預設 UI 語言，它會傳回原先安裝在系統上的文化特性。If the user has not set a default UI language, it returns the culture originally installed on the system. 如果執行緒跨越應用程式界限，而且另一個應用程式定義域中執行的程式碼，其文化特性是新建立執行緒的相同方式來決定。If the thread crosses application boundaries and executes code in another application domain, its culture is determined in the same way as that of a newly created thread. 請注意，是否您設定不同的系統安裝 UI 文化特性特定 UI 文化特性或使用者偏好的 UI 文化特性，而應用程式啟動多個執行緒，這些執行緒的目前 UI 文化特性將所傳回的文化特性`GetUserDefaultUILanguage`函式，除非您指定的文化特性執行緒正在執行的應用程式定義域中的屬性。Note that if you set a specific UI culture that is different from the system-installed UI culture or the user's preferred UI culture, and your application starts multiple threads, the current UI culture of those threads will be the culture returned by the `GetUserDefaultUILanguage` function, unless you assign a culture to the property in the application domain in which the thread is executing. ## 安全性考量Security Considerations 若要變更目前執行緒的文化特性必須具有權限值的設定。Changing the culture of the current thread requires a permission with the value set. > [!CAUTION] > 操作執行緒有危險，因為與執行緒相關聯的安全性狀態。Manipulating threads is dangerous because of the security state associated with threads. 因此，此權限應該授與然後必要時，才給可靠的程式碼。Therefore, this permission should be given only to trustworthy code, and then only as necessary. 您無法變更非完全信任的程式碼中的執行緒文化特性。You cannot change thread culture in semi-trusted code. ## 目前 UI 文化特性和 UWP 應用程式The current UI culture and UWP apps 在通用 Windows 平台 (UWP) 應用程式，屬性是讀寫，就如同它是在.NET Framework 和.NET 核心應用程式中，您可以使用它來取得和設定目前的文化特性。In Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, the property is read-write, just as it is in .NET Framework and .NET Core apps; you can use it both to get and to set the current culture. 不過，UWP 應用程式不會區分目前文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性。However, UWP apps do not distinguish between the current culture and the current UI culture. 和屬性對應中的第一個值[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)集合。The and properties map to the first value in the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) collection. 在.NET Framework 和.NET 核心應用程式，目前 UI 文化特性是每個執行緒設定，而屬性會反映目前執行緒的 UI 文化特性。In .NET Framework and .NET Core apps, the current UI culture is a per-thread setting, and the property reflects the UI culture of the current thread only. 在 UWP 應用程式，目前的文化特性都對應到[Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_)屬性，這是全域設定。In UWP apps, the current culture maps to the [Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Core.ResourceManager.DefaultContext.Languages](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.applicationmodel.resources.core.resourcecontext#properties_) property, which is a global setting. 設定屬性變更整個應用程式的文化特性，則無法設定每個執行緒為基礎的文化特性。Setting the property changes the culture of the entire app; culture cannot be set on a per-thread basis. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何變更和目前執行緒。The following code example demonstrates how to change the and of the current thread. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CPP/currentculture.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/CS/currentculture.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture2/VB/currentculture.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## OverridesOverrides 使用者可能選擇覆寫一些與目前的文化特性的 Windows 透過 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分相關聯的值。The user might choose to override some of the values associated with the current culture of Windows through the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的格式顯示日期，或使用文化特性的預設值不同的貨幣。For example, the user might choose to display the date in a different format or to use a currency other than the default for the culture. 如果是`true`和指定的文化特性符合目前的文化特性的 Windows，會使用這些覆寫，包括使用者設定之屬性的所傳回的執行個體屬性，和屬性所傳回的執行個體屬性。If is `true` and the specified culture matches the current culture of Windows, the uses those overrides, including user settings for the properties of the instance returned by the property, and the properties of the instance returned by the property. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容，例如，如果選取的行事曆不是其中一個，未定義該方法的結果和屬性的值。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the , for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the , the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 值屬性和屬性前不會計算您的應用程式存取該屬性。The value of the property and the property is not calculated until your application accesses the property. 如果使用者可以變更目前的文化特性新的文化特性時執行的應用程式，然後再應用程式存取或屬性，應用程式擷取新的文化特性，而不是覆寫的預設值原始的文化特性。If the user can change the current culture to a new culture while the application is running and then the application accesses the or property, the application retrieves the defaults for the new culture instead of the overrides for the original culture. 若要保留在原始的目前文化特性的覆寫，應用程式應該存取和屬性，然後再變更目前文化特性。To preserve the overrides for the original current culture, the application should access the and properties before changing the current culture. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範 CultureInfo.Clone 也複製和與相關聯的執行個體。The following code example shows that CultureInfo.Clone also clones the and instances associated with the . [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone/CPP/yslin_cultureinfo_clone.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone/CS/yslin_cultureinfo_clone.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.CultureInfo.Clone/VB/yslin_cultureinfo_clone.vb#1)]

summary.span: 取得或設定目前應用程式定義域中之執行緒的預設文化特性。

span.span: Gets or sets the default culture for threads in the current application domain.

value.span: 在目前的應用程式定義域中為執行緒的預設文化特性，若目前的系統文化特性是應用程式定義域中的預設執行緒文化特性，則為 。

span.span: The default culture for threads in the current application domain, or if the current system culture is the default thread culture in the application domain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]和舊版中，依預設，所有執行緒的文化特性設定為 Windows 系統的文化特性。In the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] and previous versions, by default, the culture of all threads is set to the Windows system culture. 針對目前文化特性不同於預設系統文化特性的應用程式，這種行為通常是讓人困擾。For applications whose current culture differs from the default system culture, this behavior is often undesirable. 在[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]、屬性可讓應用程式定義應用程式定義域中的所有執行緒的預設文化特性。In the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], the property enables an application to define the default culture of all threads in an application domain. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果您沒有明確設定的文化特性的任何現有應用程式定義域中，設定執行執行緒屬性也會變更這些執行緒的文化特性。If you have not explicitly set the culture of any existing threads executing in an application domain, setting the property also changes the culture of these threads. 不過，如果這些執行緒會執行另一個應用程式定義域中，則其文化特性由定義應用程式定義域中的屬性，或如果沒有預設值時，所定義的預設系統文化特性。However, if these threads execute in another application domain, their culture is defined by the property in that application domain or, if no default value is defined, by the default system culture. 因此，我們建議您明確地設定您的主應用程式執行緒的文化特性，並不依賴屬性可定義主應用程式執行緒的文化特性。Because of this, we recommend that you always explicitly set the culture of your main application thread, and not rely on the property to define the culture of the main application thread. 除非已明確地設定的值屬性是`null`，並由預設 Windows 系統的文化特性所定義的應用程式定義域中有未指派明確的文化特性的執行緒文化特性。Unless it is set explicitly, the value of the property is `null`, and the culture of threads in an application domain that have not been assigned an explicit culture is defined by the default Windows system culture. 多個文化特性、 執行緒和應用程式定義域的詳細資訊，請參閱 < 文化特性和執行緒 」 和 「 文化特性和應用程式定義域 」 章節中參考頁面。For more information about cultures, threads, and application domains, see the "Culture and threads" and "Culture and application domains" sections in the reference page. ## Examples 下列範例將說明.NET Framework 中定義新的執行緒的目前文化特性的預設行為。The following example illustrates the default behavior of the .NET Framework in defining the current culture of a new thread. 在啟動時，範例會設定目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性為法文 （法國） 以外的預設系統文化特性已法文 （法國） 的所有系統上。At startup, the example sets the current culture and the current UI culture to French (France) on all systems except those on which the default system culture is already French (France). 如果預設系統文化特性已法文 （法國），此程式碼會設定為 英文 （美國） 目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性。If the default system culture is already French (France), the code sets the current culture and the current UI culture to English (United States). 然後它會呼叫`DisplayRandomNumbers`常式，會產生三個隨機的數字，並顯示為貨幣值。It then calls the `DisplayRandomNumbers` routine, which generates three random numbers and displays them as currency values. 接下來，它會建立新的執行緒，也會執行`DisplayRandomNumbers`常式。Next, it creates a new thread, which also executes the `DisplayRandomNumbers` routine. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.DefaultThreadCurrentCulture#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.defaultthreadcurrentculture/cs/defaultculture1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.DefaultThreadCurrentCulture#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.defaultthreadcurrentculture/vb/defaultculture1.vb#1)] 範例輸出所示，當其系統的文化特性是英文 （美國） 的電腦上執行範例的主執行緒使用法文 （法國） 文化特性的格式化慣例其貨幣值的顯示。As the output from the example shows, when the example is run on a computer whose system culture is English (United States), the main thread displays its currency values using the formatting conventions of the French (France) culture. 不過，因為背景工作執行緒的文化特性衍生自目前 Windows 系統的文化特性，而不是應用程式的目前文化特性，執行緒的工作會顯示其使用英文 （美國） 文化特性的格式化慣例的貨幣值。However, because the worker thread's culture is derived from the current Windows system culture rather than the application's current culture, the work thread displays its currency values using the formatting conventions of the English (United States) culture. 下列範例會使用和屬性，以定義新的應用程式執行緒的目前 UI 文化特性與目前的文化特性。The following example uses the and properties to define the current culture and current UI culture of a new application thread. 在啟動時，範例會設定目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性為法文 （法國） 以外的預設系統文化特性已法文 （法國） 的所有系統上。At startup, the example sets the current culture and the current UI culture to French (France) on all systems except those on which the default system culture is already French (France). 如果預設系統文化特性已法文 （法國），會將目前的文化特性與目前的 UI 文化特性設為英文 （美國）。If the default system culture is already French (France), it sets the current culture and the current UI culture to English (United States). 然後它會呼叫`DisplayRandomNumbers`常式，會產生三個隨機的數字，並顯示為貨幣值。It then calls the `DisplayRandomNumbers` routine, which generates three random numbers and displays them as currency values. 接下來，它會建立新的執行緒，也會執行`DisplayRandomNumbers`常式。Next, it creates a new thread, which also executes the `DisplayRandomNumbers` routine. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.DefaultThreadCurrentCulture#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.defaultthreadcurrentculture/cs/defaultculture2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.CultureInfo.DefaultThreadCurrentCulture#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.cultureinfo.defaultthreadcurrentculture/vb/defaultculture2.vb#2)] 範例輸出所示，當其系統的文化特性是英文 （美國） 的電腦上執行範例主執行緒和背景工作執行緒會顯示其使用法文 （法國） 文化特性的格式化慣例的貨幣值。As the output from the example shows, when the example is run on a computer whose system culture is English (United States), both the main thread and the worker thread display their currency values using the formatting conventions of the French (France) culture.
